intro: Hieracium languidifolium, commonly known as the languid-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks in temperate regions. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
